p: The antimicrobial activity of Lavandula has been widely studied [ 18, 19, 20]. Lavender plants have been used as a relaxant in aromatherapy [ 21, 22]. Antioxidant and antiviral activities of Lavandula essential oil have been reported [ 23, 24, 25]. Therefore, this study aims to provide information on volatile constituents of in the essential oils from different organs (flowers, leaves, stems, and roots) of L. pubescens using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (GC-MS) and the antibacterial activities of different plant parts of L. pubescens.
